definition: to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope

sentences.english: Horses are herded to safety away from the volcanic cloud.
sentences.chinese: 成羣的馬匹正飛奔逃離火山熔岩灰霧。

sentences.english: Numerous fairy people gallop to disembark.
They rode at full gallop down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 他們騎着馬往山下飛奔而去。

sentences.english: He jumped onto the horse and galloped in the direction of the temple .
sentences.chinese: 他跳上馬，朝寺廟方向飛奔而去。

sentences.english: He ran out of the house in his pajamas.
sentences.chinese: 他着睡衣褲，從房子裏飛奔了出來。

sentences.english: The zebra galloped away from the lion.
sentences.chinese: 斑馬疾馳飛奔遠離獅子。

sentences.english: The song guided me to where you were.
sentences.chinese: 這歌引導我向你飛奔而去。

sentences.english: A rider came pounding up with an order from the commander in chief.
sentences.chinese: 一個騎着馬的人帶着總司令的命令嗒嗒地飛奔而來。

sentences.english: She jumped on her bicycle and raced to the library.
sentences.chinese: 她跳上自行車向圖書館飛奔而去。

sentences.english: The boy rushed past me with a policeman close on his heels.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩從我身邊飛奔而過，有個警察緊追在後。

sentences.english: O storm, embodied, rising, careering with swift steps along the beach!
sentences.chinese: 啊，暴風雨已然成形，高漲，沿着海岸飛奔。

sentences.english: Manrico leaves to find her immediately.
sentences.chinese: 曼里科立即向修道院飛奔而去。

sentences.english: I took the shirt and hurried to the side of the dying Mute Singer.
sentences.chinese: 我拿起法衣，飛奔到奄奄一息的“沉默的歌手”身旁。

sentences.english: Savoring the silence, we turned our horses around and they fell into a gallop.
sentences.chinese: 此時一片寂靜，我們掉轉馬頭，馬兒開始飛奔起來。

sentences.english: The party defeated the helmet of rejected will inevitably, flying for lost.
sentences.chinese: 廝殺結果，打敗的一方免不了會棄盔丟甲，飛奔逃命。

sentences.english: This used to be the place we ran to.
sentences.chinese: 這兒曾是我們飛奔而去的地方。

definition: (of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
to pursue/to chase after/to accelerate/to catch up with/to overtake
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
to start/to set in motion/to move/to march/to dig in (eating)/to tuck in (eating)
